qas.question: When was the British East India Company chartered?
When was the Dutch East India Company chartered?
When had the British East India Company overtaken the Dutch East India Company in sales?
How many Anglo-Dutch Wars were there in the 17th century?
The Dutch East India Company focused on trade in which industry?

context: At the end of the 16th century, England and the Netherlands began to challenge Portugal's monopoly of trade with Asia, forming private joint-stock companies to finance the voyages—the English, later British, East India Company and the Dutch East India Company, chartered in <a0_0>1600<a0_0/> and <a1_0>1602<a1_0/> respectively. The primary aim of these companies was to tap into the lucrative spice trade, an effort focused mainly on two regions; the East Indies archipelago, and an important hub in the trade network, India. There, they competed for trade supremacy with Portugal and with each other. Although England ultimately eclipsed the Netherlands as a colonial power, in the short term the Netherlands' more advanced financial system and the <a3_0>three<a3_0/> Anglo-Dutch Wars of the 17th century left it with a stronger position in Asia. Hostilities ceased after the Glorious Revolution of 1688 when the Dutch William of Orange ascended the English throne, bringing peace between the Netherlands and England. A deal between the two nations left the <a4_0>spice<a4_0/> trade of the East Indies archipelago to the Netherlands and the textiles industry of India to England, but textiles soon overtook spices in terms of profitability, and by <a2_0>1720<a2_0/>, in terms of sales, the British company had overtaken the Dutch.
